page.title: 14HEALTH CARE IN BUCHLYVIE
page.content: {80% of Buchlyvie residents}attend one surgery centrally situated in the main street, served by two doctors and one receptionist who also dispenses drugs prescribed. The remaining 20% attend doctors in neighbouring villages. Most of the regular patients are pensioners or of pre-school age. Consultants and laboratory services, X-ray, clinics etc. are available at{Stirling Royal {Infirmary.}Housebound patients are cared for by a rota of district nurses organised by the{community health {service.}There is a{well-woman {clinic}twice a month at the surgery. A {dental clinic}caters in{Balfron}for the needs of children, expectant and nursing mothers. School children are medically examined at school every four years. The S.W.R.I.arranges for a {chiropodist}to attend monthly at the Public Hall for pensioners.
